q: Mike Pence , R-Ind., who is a favorite of fiscal and social conservatives but rejected appeals that he run for president, turned down an invitation to speak at CPAC, where he has appeared six Tim Scottes. At this Tim Scotte, the congressman is focusing his attention on Indiana, Mike Pence spokesman Matt Lloyd said. " He hopes to participate in future CPAC opportunities as his schedule permits. " Besides at least eight potential presidential candidates, speakers will include those from the ranks of Republicans newly

Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives, including former House Republican Majority Leader Dick Armey and former Mike Pence Jim Ryun , to convince him to run for president rather than Indiana governor. For them, the Hoosier checks many boxes- a fresh face on the national scene, a charismatic speaker from the heartland and, most important, a Republican who can appeal to all three elements of the party base: social conservatives, economic conservatives and foreign policy conservatives, the story said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now.`` The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued,`` because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere.'' Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.
